results.title: You can't always tell
results.creator_credit: Scott Hicks, Terry Jennings and Chrysalis Films
results.brief_description: This film aims to inform children in the seven to twelve age group of the problem of child molesting. It contains a series of dramatised scenes showing situations in which children can find themselves. Shows children how to avoid putting themselves at risk with strangers.

results.title: You are welcome sirs, to Cyprus
results.creator_credit: Richard Gilbert and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A view of the troubled island of Cyprus from the point of view of Canadian soldiers of the United Nations peace force who were called upon to help keep the peace until agreement could be reached between the Greek and Turkish factions. General Thimayya of India, commander of the UN troops, explains his responsibility. Among the Cypriots who appear in this film are Archbishop Makarios and Dr Kutchuk, the Turkish vice-president. Commentary by Jos Reeve.

results.title: You are on Indian land
results.creator_credit: George C. Stoney and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film report of the 1969 protest demonstration by Mohawk Indians of the St. Regis Reserve on the international bridge between Canada and the United States near Cornwall, Ontario. By blocking the bridge, which is on the Reserve, and causing a considerable tie-up of motor traffic, the Indians drew public attention to their grievance that they were prohibited by Canadian authorities from duty-free passage of personal purchases across the border; a right they claim was established by the Jay Treaty of 1794. The film shows the confrontation with police, and ensuing action. (Awards: New York; Toronto.)
results.creator_credit_for_label: George C. Stoney and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: You are not alone
results.creator_credit: Jennie Blackwood, Zanthus Films and Anti Cancer Council
results.brief_description: Tells the story of a woman who reports a suspected cancer early and undergoes a successful operation. Dramatically presents the advantages of seeking prompt treatment when the warning signs of cancer appear. The patient is referred to a surgeon who, after the operation, introduces the therapy radiographers who complete the treatment to eradicate the disease.

results.title: You and your school council
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Mark Laughlin and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Highlights the new roles and responsibilities of school councils. Emphasizes the participation of parents, students and teachers in school governance; and the importance of collaborative decision making in developing school policies and priorities. Encourages parents to become involved in school councils.

results.title: You and your five senses
results.brief_description: An animated cartoon featuring Jiminy Cricket discussing man’s five senses, explaining that some are more highly developed than others and that man compensates accordingly.

results.title: You and the computer
results.brief_description: Illustrates with live action and simple animation the concept: the computer works the same way you do. It is designed to acquaint the audience with a single aspect of the computer’s function and to arouse interest in future computer-related study. Points our that a trained person with a computer can perform a bigger block of mental work in an afternoon than he could in a lifetime with paper and pencil.
